page.description: Return the last unused entry in the array.
page.original:
&ltARRAY>.FIRST_EMPTY() Syntax Index as N = &ltARRAY>.FIRST_EMPTY() Description The &ltARRAY>.FIRST_EMPTY() method returns the index of the first NULL element in an array. Example Assume an array "A" contains the following elements: ElementValue A[1]Orange A[2]Banana A[3]Apple A[4]Pineapple A[5]Mango A[6] A[7] A[8] ? A.first_empty() = 6 ' because element 6 is the first NULL (empty) element.
See Also Array Functions and Methods
